definitions.definition: the main bad character in a story, play, etc.

examples.text: He often plays the part of the villain.
He doesn't fit the standard stereotype of a movie villain.
He has played villains in most of his films.
He wore a black cloak, like a pantomime villain.
The Queen in ‘Snow White’ is one of film's greatest villains.

definitions.definition: a person who is morally bad or responsible for causing trouble or harm

examples.text: the heroes and villains of the 20th century
Industrialized nations are the real environmental villains.
He felt that the insurance companies were the real villains in all this.
She seems to have cast me as the villain in her latest emotional upheaval.
The police still haven't caught the villain.

definitions.definition: the person or thing that is responsible for all the trouble in a situation

examples.text: It’s hard to identify the real villain of the piece in this case.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘a rustic, boor’): from Old French vilein, based on Latin villa.
